newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Italy moving in right direction for EMU-de Silguy.
newsitem.headline: Italy moving in right direction for EMU-de Silguy.

text.p: Italy is moving in the right direction to join Europe's single currency project by the start date of 1999, European Commissioner Yves-Thibault de Silguy said, adding the euro would start on time.
"Italy is moving in the right direction," he told Reuters when asked if Italy would qualify in 1999.

Asked about the timetable, he said: "A delay is not possible. If we want to change the date we have to change the whole treaty. And now the process is so advanced that it is impossible for member states and companies to slow down. We will create more problems if we want to delay it."
"The process is irreversible and the euro will be in place on January 1, 1999," he said. He said a majority of EU states would qualify, but he did not elaborate.
De Silguy praised Italy's efforts to cut its deficits.
"Italy has made fantastic efforts to reduce excessive public deficits and prepared reforms to be ready in due time," he said.
"This year the decisions of Italy's government will cause a reduction in public deficits of between 3.5 and 3.7 percent and that is the most important reduction made in Europe for 15 years."
